Reviews.Title: “Appears a bit dated, but rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: ijsbeer
Reviews.Content: The general areas, such as the lobby, hallways, etc. may appear dated but we were pleasantly surprised with the spacious, comfortable and clean rooms. Though the bathroom could also have done with some modernisation, this was made up for the fact that the surprisingly large room, even though only booked for 1 person, easily accomodated 2 adults and a child. We stayed on 2 seperate occasions in 2 different rooms, both of equal standard. The staff was very helpful in allowing us to leave the room a few hours later than the normal check-out team. Overall we paid 45 Euros per night, which we believed was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: r0bb029
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Convencion for three nights in early September. It is very easy to get from the airport using the airport express bus which stops about 1/4 mile away from the hotel, on the same road. The hotel does look dated but was clean and comfortable, and worthy of its four stars. The staff were not overly friendly but were professional and helpful. We stayed in room 8002 which we think was near the front of the hotel and there was no view to speak of, but given its location I doubt if any of the rooms have a view. The room had a safe which was free of charge and a handy fridge. Hairdryer in the bathroom. It was hot while we were there and the aircon worked beautifully. Maid service every day, who did a great job. This hotel is close to Retiro Park, but quite a distance to some sights, but I believe there are several buses and the metro you could use if you didn,t want to walk. The hotel has a couple of lovely coffee shops underneath and there are a few bars and restuarantes in close vacinity. All in all this hotel was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: dfox82
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel located about 15mins train ride to the main city. The staff are okay to deal with and the food at the hotel is also good. The lack of natural light in the hotel is a bit of a downer but overall it's not a bad place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JR-KSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the recommended hotel for the Rock-n-Rock Madrid Marathon. It was ok and comfortable, but the whole property was quite dated. The location is close to the Retiro Park, but it is not very convenient to most tourist sites we wanted to visit. The staff was very professional and friendly. We loved the small coffee shop and cafe in front of the hotel. The ladies that work there are very friendly, and the deserts are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Still great but AC not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Brit_Abroad13
Reviews.Content: Visited here again mid-July '12 when it was very hot. The room was functional and the staff attentive as usual. Not over-impressed with the AC though, once I had found the controls (hidden behind the door into bedroom), I set them to the coolest setting but even then the room temperature did not drop below warm. The lobby is bright and airy and there are plenty of lifts so I was never waiting long for one. Two things to note, the currency exchange in reception cannot process debit/credit cards it is cash only (though there are ATM's nearby), also if ordering a Pizza from the Telepizza in-room menu, it may be worth you while taking the 5 minute walk to collect it yourself and save 60%!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: moxitahcerezo
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with great service! Also very clean. It's not too far away from the centre. The best way to get there is by taking either the underground or the bus, walking would take about 30 minutes. For food, you can either eat at the hotel or at a restaurant nearby. There are many places with reasonable prices and great food. You also get half an hour per day of free internet in the Lobby, otherwise it's paying and it's quite expensive. When I went there last year with my boyfriend in August the prices were 25 euros a night per person.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon E
Reviews.Content: If you want to see what your really going to get. ( or at least what we got) look at the photos on this site and the green bedrooms. Also the location is poor with a decent walk to the metro. Luckily we spent 80% of our time in the city

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Convencion Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this hotel to friends visiting Madrid. It was superb value for money, perfectly placed in a friendly " medical" neighbourhood with its own restaurants and cafes but within one short bus trip to the centre of Madrid. It is also very close to the bus stop of the cheap and frequent airport shuttle bus Reception and security staff were always helpful with information about sights, transport etc. And there is an El Corte Ingles very nearbye!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DaveSimpson3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Convencion for our stay in Madrid and had no major issues with the hotel. It is very pleasant when you walk in with a beautiful lobby area and you can enjoy 30 free mins of wifi to go with your free drink and nibbles. The room was fine, not superb but not disappointing either. The bathroom and room were spacious and there was a safe and decent size TV. It is very close to Buen Retiro Park and there is also a metro (Occonnell) nearby to take you anywhere in the city. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management attitude”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I sent two emails messages to the hotel email address, requesting the account be charged to my VISA Card, Ms Beitseen & Ms Givargis guest at the hotel were forced to pay out of their own pocket, I never received a response from the Hotel to my request. Carlo Frizziero

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalie M
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of our holiday. On entering the hotel, we were very impressed. The whole place looked rather grand and we thought that our room would be lovely if the decoration of the lobby was anything to go by. The staff at the reception desk were nice, and we were able to check in swiftly. There is free wifi for 30 minutes in reception. However, there is no free wifi at the hotel and the rates they charge for the wifi are incredibly high. When we entered our room on the 3rd floor, however, we were incredibly disappointed. Although the room was relatively large, the decor in the room was incredibly dated. Because of this, we felt very mislead as the room was not representative of how the hotel portrayed the rooms on their website. The curtains were closed when we entered the room, so we decided to open the curtains but it didn't help at all with the level of light in the room. We arrived at 4 o'clock in the afternoon and the light entering our room could have fooled you into it being about 9 o'clock, maybe even later. The lack of natural light in the room was a huge sticking point. The room did have a large TV and a comfortable bed, although there were no extra pillows available. Nice place to stay because of the location (very close to Parque del Buen Retiro) and I believe we would have had a more pleasant stay if we had a different room, but I wouldn't stay again as it seems to be pot luck whether you receive a nice or bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Convencion hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like stepping back into the 70's!The majority of staff at the hotel were very helpful. Breakfast is very minimal. There is a selection of tinned fruit,cereal,cold meat and bread. I am ceoliac and the hotel provided a gluten free cereal and bun but no bread. At night the hotel there can be a lot of noise from the enterance. We did call the reception and the staff dealt with it very quickly. The hotel itself is at least a 10 minute taxi ride into the centre of Madrid but there is a metro station near by.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: holidayArbroath
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on Trip Advisor about this hotel my friend and I were dubious before our arrival. However, we had a fantastic room, being on the top floor at the back of the hotel. It had a walk-in wardrobe with loads of hanging space, drawers and shelves. The twin room itself was massive with sitting areas at both ends of the room. The bathroom was huge with double sink, bath and shower. Our towels were changed every day of our four day stay. The only thing we would have welcomed would have been tea and coffee making facilities. Every staff member at reception we spoke to was very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “price quality very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location, a litle far away from the center of the city. Metro about 300 mtrs away. Further very good hotel, good braekfast.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Joanne R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend with my companion as we wanted somewhere that was within close proximity of the Palacio de los deportes de Madrid as we were seeing Enrique in concert. The hotel is superb with lovely clean & spacious rooms & excellent breakfast. It was brilliant value for money. The only complaint was the noise at night that echoed from outside as people checked in & out of reception, \I guess there is very little that can be done about that though. Reccommended!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “location great, great value”
Reviews.Author: paxo123
Reviews.Content: room clean, good bathroom, breakfast pricey but great little private cafe near entrance! huge queques for check in and check out but prepaid voucher accepted without problems and baggage stored safe last day till flight time. could do with extra pillows but for the price we paid can have no complaints. ..very near metro and on road near airport express bus stop, can walk everywhere. actually have got one complaint but only about customers at front entrance who make a crowd puffing on fags...very unpleasant to pass them by....

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: chusair
Reviews.Content: Location location location, what a petty that this hotel is not owned by a great franchise, it is in a great location, two short walking distance blocks from the metro which make it perfect if you are planning a budget vacation to Madrid. It is also at walking distance of main attraction like Museo del Prado, Parque del Retiro and this in a way compensate for what is a real lack of luxury. But common guys yiu are only paying a fraction of the price of what a hotel with this location will cost

Reviews.Title: “Kitsch is the word!”
Reviews.Author: LunaYoga
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2011. The staff were extremely friendly and sorted all our problems out straightway. Firstly our booking had been wiped from the computer when the system crashed, then we were given a twin room for three of us then our safe did not work! But the staff were really endearing so I have no complaints! Madrid is a small city and this hotel was a great location as you could walk into the main part of town in less than 10 minutes. I wouldn't want to stay in the centre of town as it is very noisy. It's also less than 5 mins from retro park which is beautiful and is close to the tube station and supermarkets. It's a little dated but as i said the kitschness makes up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid with no hurry”
Reviews.Author: 977Sandy
Reviews.Content: The Convencion is an average hotel, a little distant from the city center but close enough to the Parque del Retiro, a beautiful park. Food options are not good nearby so you have to take a taxi - which is not expensive over there. It´s kind of old and the breakfast at the group part is really poor, but if you´re not in a group it´s way better. However, you pay more for a room that´s pretty much the same and on top of that you have to pay to use the safety box as well. The hotel receives many groups of teenagers who can be really noisy late at night...

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff at the hotel were very friendly and polite and security conscious. the room itself was very nice, however was sometimes too warm and the pilows were slightly hard with no spares but the beds were comfortable. the hotel is located a 2 minute walk to the o'don,nel metro stop and a 5 minute walk to retiro parkwhich was very useful for getting the metro to/from the airport or the local tourist attractions, with plenty of restaraunts close by for evening meals and also a mini supermarket. breakfast was a typical european style breakfast of croissants, rolls, ham, cheese, juices and hot drinks. the items for breakfast were fresh everyday and was tasty, but they also had cereals and there was plenty of places to sit. would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Pleasant Enough”
Reviews.Author: Brit_Abroad13
Reviews.Content: Single night stay on a business trip so a functional, convenient hotel was all I needed. This ticked both the boxes. The evening meal (a la carte rather than buffet) was wonderful, I was extremely surprised by how good. As other reviewers have commented the proximity of the Airport bus was a huge bonus and it was not too far to stroll to some of the more 'central' locations. The staff were polite and efficient so my lack of Spanish was not a problem, the only issue I had was with the temperature in the room; despite having an AC system I could not get it to work and as my window opened onto an small enclosed space there was no chanc of a breeze. Would stay there again despie this, though perhaps I'll avoid the summer!

Reviews.Title: “OK but drawbacks!”
Reviews.Author: James93
Reviews.Content: This seemed a pleasant enough hotel for our weekend visit. There was a clean spacious entrance hall and the room and bathroom were also fine. Breakfast and evening meal offered an excellent choice of good food and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Nearly all spoke good English. There were two drawbacks. The rooms was extremely hot with heating seemingly at maximum but the air conditioning controls were switched off. The only control was to open the window. Unfortunately the room opened onto a small courtyard where it would be easy to step out, or other people step into your room, so it had to be locked for security if you were leaving the room. I tried sleeping with it open, but people from three floors up had their window open and were making a lot of noise as well as tossing bottles and cups out of their window to crash onto the tiled patio. So the window had to be shut. I was awakened at 1, 3 and 5am by people shouting and running up the corridors. I heard another of our group go out and shout at them to be quiet. So it was hardly a restful night's sleep.Others in our group had the same disturbed night. So take a set of strong wax earplugs .. and hope you can still hear your alarm clock in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Convencion on Calle o'Donnell in Madrid Spain”
Reviews.Author: Joy8891
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; clean, warm and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. A big plus for this hotel is you can get an express (yellow) airport bus from any terminal to this hotel . The bus stops virtually outside the hotel, it is the first stop after leaving the airport and it only costs 2 Euro's. For getting into the center of Madrid (Playa Major) there are bus and Metro stops very close to the hotel. However if you like walking it only takes about 40 minutes to walk into the centre through a beautiful park (Parque De El Retiro ) To get to the Prado museum it only takes about 25 miutes to walk.

Reviews.Title: “i dont what people expect as you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: relfie
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel, and cant fault it, very quick check in, staff speak quite good english and are very polite.room was alot bigger than expected and very clean. room cleaned every day with fresh towels. didnt eat in the hotel so can not comment on this lots of shops nearby. and very easy to catch a bus to other parts of the city. would def stay here again if visiting madrid remember you get what you pay for and i feel that i got good value for my money and after all i didnt plan on spending alot of time in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, spacious but disgusting rooms, and the 'continental breakfast'....... Wouldnt feed it to a starving homeless pers”
Reviews.Author: Adzwee
Reviews.Content: Positives..... Safety deposit box, the metro(within 100m), secuirty guards. Negatives...... No cutlery or crockery, old fashioned decor, mouldy bathroom, fag ash over the floors, dirty rugs that look like they have NEVER been cleaned. I would advise that no human or rhodent eats at the advised restaurant that this hotel serves its B&B from, I wouldnt feed it to a starving homeless person!! Definetly not a four star, and definetly not reccomended!! I want my money back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor standards,highly not recommended !!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce B
Reviews.Content: Well I wouldn't say that's a 4stars standard ......very old hotel,poor facilities,especially for young couple I don't suggest it's worth to stay. We booked a double from but got a 2single beds instead... Overall the hotel is old I don't really see why it's a 4stars,highly not recommended!!! The only good thing is quite convenient ...from the airport take am airport express,2euro pp,first stop is the hotel just 3mins always from the stop...other than that....nothing really worth to stay for a good holiday...... Btw no kettle facility (no tea coffee boilling water)in the room...can that be 4stars??? Poor thing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big, well situated, poor standards”
Reviews.Author: BobDB
Reviews.Content: The Convencion is very easy to find, but be ready to swing in to the courtyard as soon as you reach the hotel on Calle O'Donnell. It is a very big hotel, has a lot of tourist business including bus tours. The rooms are fine, but the fixtures and fittings, bedding etc are showing signs of age. Thje staff are friendly, the food is good. The rooms overlooking Calle O'Donnell are very noisy, very late in to the night. As the prices are low [we paid €68 for a double room, €12 for a very good breakfast]. The Parador del Jamon is a restaurant right next door to the hotel. It is a genuine Spanish restaurant with reasnable prices and stringly recommended for dinner whilst staying at the Convencion.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: espoir2103
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights. Good location. Tube station O'Donnell is next to the hotel and Retiro and city cenre are by walking distance. The room wasnt bad except the fact that the view from the window was a wall but didnt like the bathroom-didnt look very clean and the door couldnd be closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LutosFriend
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Madrid from St. Louis via Miami and went straight into a meeting at Hotel Convencion. The lobby is really nice, the meeting rooms and services seem fine, too. The room was a bit small, but it was only me and I felt I could stay there for longer than the one night, if needed. At first, I was taken aback because I was expecting a nicer hotel - they do say 4-Star. Though it's not a 4-Star, it is a very reasonable value for the room which was clean, quiet, and felt safe. The location is outstanding! I was able to take a bus to the city center in just a couple minutes and probably could have walked if I had more time. The staff also spoke very good English at the front desk, and my Spanish is good enough (I think) that I had no problems at any meals. I would stay at this hotel again - especially if it were only me on the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Centric, affordable and very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loquif
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and I was satisfied with the hotel. The hotel infrastructure is old, but rooms count with a modern TV and telephone system. There are not great views that can be seen from the room but the hotel is very well located near Madrid's downtown. Access to go and come from Barajas airport is great, the Airport Express bus stops across the street and a few blocks away from the hotel. Breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is not a 4 Star but is comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jthomas1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel late October and early November. I had booked it as a four star hotel listed by them. It was definitely not a four star hotel but was comfortable and convenient to central city Madrid. There were many cafe's and coffee shops close to the hotel. Several buses stop right by this hotel and getting to the airport was easy (2 euros). Hotel could use a little tweaking as it is old and opening the windows gets you a good bit of street noise, but it did not keep us awake. Walking distance to a lot of sights in Madrid. No breakfast and a charge for wi-fi and charge at the business center to use the computers

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Gina W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary in November. The room was modern and clean but view through window was of three walls and was awful. No sunlight could enter the room and you literally had to stick your head out of the window and look up to see what the weather was like!!! (We were on the second floor). The whole hotel felt very 'closed in'.This hotel does not go out of its way to cater for the English,it's very Spanish, although the staff were polite when you spoke to them. However they could not understand basics like 'no milk in coffee, or black coffee please!' On a positive note there was lashings of hot water and free cosmetics in bathroom replenished daily, Breakfast was varied and enjoyable but finding a table for two was difficult as it was so busy. Although they advertise cocktails served in the bar in the hotel information (on television in bedroom) they didn't and could not offer a cocktail menu on request, The hotel is situated near O'donnell metro station which is on the grey circular line. You need to change after one stop to red line 2 to get to tourist attractions in Madrid. Watch the beggars and watch your valuables! We got approached several times throughout our two day stay. Luggage can be kept in the luggage room which is manned all day by a member of staff. I wouldn't choose this hotel again, but is is okay for a quick stop over.

Reviews.Title: “5 nights.”
Reviews.Author: sancyn
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from airport on airport bus.(2euro each) Fairly central but bit of a trek to metro. You can walk to city centre, approx 30minutes. Old hotel. Large but comfortable. Some noise from next rooms. Rooms clean but overall a little 'tired'. Continental breakfast not included and a little expensive, although there are plenty of places to get food/drink on way to centre. The hotel is on main road, but we did not hear too much traffic noise. Very close to Retiro park which is certainly worth a trip.

Reviews.Title: “7 Nights in October of 2011”
Reviews.Author: Rich366
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in October from Oct 22nd – Oct 29th. The location of this hotel is great and central to everything. It is located directly in the city so expect the sights and sounds of a city. My room was directly next to the main street that crosses and heard plenty of the normal street sounds. The location is a few block from the amazing Parque Del Retiro. The overall condition of the room is excellent, with a large bed, tv, and bathroom. The hotel staff does an excellent job of cleaning the rooms. You are in Spain so I would expect you to know the language. I was able to check in and out of the hotel with English and Spanish. The hotel is directly adjacent to many different breakfast, lunch, and dinner spots. If you are looking to see the Top 10 Spots in Madrid via the List on Trip Advisor I was able to walk with my girlfriend to every one of these spots from the hotel. Taxis sit right outside and can be called by the doorman if you prefer to catch a ride. I walked 8 hours a day around the city from the hotel. I was able to walk back and forth from to all the sites from this location. The shopping is excellent and the transit is excellent. There is an airport shuttle that drops off and picks up two blocks away from the hotel but I opted to take a taxi. The taxi from the Airport to the Hotel was around a 15 – 20 min drive and is around 25 – 30 Euros. I believe the shuttle is 4 Euros per person with 2 city blocks of walking. I don’t know the time it takes but I did opt to take the taxi instead. Overall I thought it was a very good hotel. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Really Convenient for Concerts”
Reviews.Author: Twangs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as we were going to a concert at the Palacio de Los Deportes.... Location is good as it is 2 minutes walk from the Arena and approx 5-10 minutes from Central Madrid (6 euros in a taxi), I would not like to stay here for more than 2 nights, but it was clean and our family room was big enough and comfortable. I think the building was excellent 15-20 years ago but needs a refurbishment. Negatives are - The door staff do not even say hello let alone help anyone with luggage they are just shockingly bad and as its your first impression this really sticks in your mind !! Also do not believe any offer on their website of a free drink if you show your ticket to a concert, as they tell you it does not exist even if you show them their own website !!! If there was another concert, I would put up with the outdated decor, as the location is so good, but they really need to change their door staff as they are just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Needs urgent update”
Reviews.Author: folky
Reviews.Content: It is a four star hotel, but I dont know if they got them 60 years ago and no one reviewed them since then! It's old, noisy, furniture is falling apart, bathroom shower is all plastic and doesn't work well. The bed was really uncomfortable, the only plug near the bed was not working, tv was really old and it went on and off when it felt like... a disaster!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not a 4 star property”
Reviews.Author: Pedro P
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Convencion Madrid, the hotel offered a decent size room, bed was not very confortable and very hard and has a very small window. I got a room facing the back street just above a club called Golden Boite, and got free enterteinment till about 04h30 AM. Value was overall good, breakfast was expensive for the choice and qualiry. Location was near subway O`Donnell (1.50 euros ride to city center) or you could walk a good 45 minutes to the downtown core of the city. Added bonus: hotel located just a few meters from the Bus stop to the Barajas Airport (2 euros ride and 24 hour service).

Reviews.Title: “Pictures on ad/website”
Reviews.Author: Sigridg304
Reviews.Content: Do not believe what you see in the pictures! THIS IS NOT TRUE! The bedsheets we're dirty, the pillows we're stained...i had to spread my sweatshirt to sleep on! And this hotel could do with a make up! Too old for a modern society!

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel but OK in general”
Reviews.Author: 168espanola
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband 4 nights. Positive: LOCATION - bus stop to the airport across the road; to the Retiro park in only 10 minutes walk; Metro O'Donnell not very well connected so we moved by walking or buses easily. Very dated hotel and rooms but clean and confy beds. Staff not very friendly; did the minimum. In order not to be disappointed, think that you are in a 3 star hotel not 4 and you'll be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime, but still good value”
Reviews.Author: MikTheViking
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Convención is a large hotel, with big rooms (by European standards), well maintained but showing signs of its advancing age. The staff are efficient, the meals standardized, the beds comfortable, the water hot when needed. And the price is as good as it gets (tip: use the hotel’s own booking site for the best deals going). City communications: excellent shuttle bus connection to and from Madrid’s international airport (Barajas) as the bus stops just outside. Taxis are readily available (Atocha railway station for both high-speed and ‘normal’ trains) is about a six Euro trip away (including the surcharge for luggage). However, this hotel is not very close to the main tourist sites: the big squares, monuments, avenues, galleries or museums. The Madrid metro system has stations nearby that serve two of the main subway lines for those who have the time. Otherwise it’s back to taxis for those not-to-be-missed sightseeing days and entertainment-filled nights. Faded glory? Yes. Scuffed in places? Yes. But the well-built old dame of a hotel still presents a good face, attentive service and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This can't be a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: playtime1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights......although all is not bad ,as the shower has enough power to blast you in orbit ,and the beds are quite good .....the rest is very poor.... 1) the room had no coffee making facilities ,no mini bar,bedroom funiture was very dated and the bathroom had seen better days 2)the breakfast buffet was not great ......luke warm food 3)the maid forgot to do the room and had to remind reception ......in all fairness they got it sorted. 4) the staff were not that freindly,but were ok... I have stayed in lots of 4 star hotels all over Spain,generally they are very good but found this one poor and am very surpised this hotel has kept its 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Fine for event at Palacio de los Deportes”
Reviews.Author: ELLASECRET
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were visiting London for our 40th birthdays, and decided to make a quick trip to Madrid to see a concert at Palacio de los Deportes. Because I had never been to Spain and speak very little Spanish, I specifically chose a hotel based on its proximity to the event venue. While this hotel isn't BAD, it really has nothing else going for it other than good location to this Palacio. I read the reviews and was concerned about rudeness and a shabby room. Actually, it was "fine." There was an older man working the desk in the evenings who didn't go out of his way to be rude, but shouldn't be in the service industry either. However, there was a woman also working at the same time, and she was more approachable, but not extremely friendly either. However, we weren't struck by blatant rudeness. If you want someone sucking up to you all the time, this isn't the place for you. The room was older and dated, but not dirty. Furnishing were shabby, but we weren't looking for pristine accommodations, just something clean, safe, and within walking distance of our concert. We didn't use any of the services other than the business center area for internet service. I believe it was one Euro for ten minutes of internet service. There is a bus from the airport which drops you off about a block from the hotel. The bus costs 2 Euros per person and drops you off at the O'Donnell stop. Make sure you change money before landing at Madrid Airport. We landed in Terminal 1 and spent about 3 hours after deplaning trying to find a currency exchange service. After jumping through hoops, someone finally directed us to Terminal 4, but it was not easy to get there. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: lolly888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was no where near as bad as I expected it to be from the reviews, its is a little out of date and the beds are not the comfiest, but it was all very clean and the staff were very helpful and once getting extra pillows from reception the beds were much better! It was close to 2 different metro stations and really close to the retiro park which was very nice to spend time in! The hotel was very good value for money compared to anything else I found when I booked this 2 days before we went.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved since my last stay, in 2008”
Reviews.Author: CostinN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2008, they probably refurbished (most/ some/ all) the rooms, looks much better now, in 2011. Booked a triple, but were offered an upgrade to suite at check-in. Very nice of them. They also respected my request regarding a room at top floor, not facing any of the surrounding streets. It helps in terms of sound-proofing. The hotel is very well placed, only 10-min walk to Retiro Park. Much better position to stay than in center of Madrid, very noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth four stars”
Reviews.Author: Wheninrome60713
Reviews.Content: We just finished our stay at Hotel Convecion. I was quite disappointed. I read the previous ratings and was quite apprehensive. If you read some of the bad reviews, they are not exaggerated. However, to be fair the following are some good points: room was somewhat clean but towels and sheets were stained, the hotel is located at the first airport bus stop from the airport terminal and near El Retiro Park and metro. Some bad points - the service was awful. We opted for the continental breakfast. Don't bother! Waiters were rude! I sat there waiting for coffee to be served only to watch three other people get their coffee. Perhaps, the waiters are not accustomed to serving folks three shades darker than them.

Reviews.Title: “practical location, quiet rooms available”
Reviews.Author: cho67
Reviews.Content: I might not count this one to be a 4-star hotel really, but in any case, we were happy with the quality compared to price. We stayed here twice (2 nights + 1 night) during our trip and asked to get a quiet room, and that we got - not so self-clear in Madrid! Rooms were a bit worn-out but clean, and beds were comfortable. Bathrooms were spacious and very clean. The location is good, within walking distance to the downtown, and close to O'Donnell metro station and Retiro park. There is 24h reception, which is nice if arriving late.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoglets
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night but the hotel had two very good redeeming features. I really needed the room until 3 PM and they gave it to me without charging me. They had menus for a pizza place that delivered to the hotel rooms. This is an excellent way to eat in your room while avoiding the usually mediocre quality of room service. Room prices were also very reasonable. There were usually lines at the reception for checking in and out. There is free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a 4 stars hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Marzia19821
Reviews.Content: The entrance of the hotel was very nice but the rooms were absolutely poor and old. Bathroom was old as well but clean. The breakfast was not so bad and the people, although they don't speak English, are very nice. Unfortunately it was the closest to the hospital and therefore the best venue for my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Value”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenDan
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel within the good price range. Stayed for 5 nights and started of the stay with checking in at 12:30 noon and got a room on the 7th floor. The room was very modern with hair dryer and safe in the room. The cleaning staff was simply excellent nothing less! The noise level was very low and the tv with a lot of good channels would even compensate for noise. I find hotels in Madrid to be noisy normally so I always bring earplugs with me. So far this has been my best stay in Madrid and that is comparing it with apart hotels etc. Also the staff at reception was good at helping me with locations. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it appears in the Ads!”
Reviews.Author: MikeEdge58
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. I booked due to a British Airways very highly recommended review. Lobby furniture and rugs and carpet are very old and very dirty. Your clothes will get dirty if you sit on the chairs or couches. Front desk does not have enough personnel to take care of the check in nor check out process. Check in may take 30 minutes and check out will take over an hour. Rooms are not soundproof. You may hear your neighbors snoring or cars on the street or conversations on the street from your room. No regulation of heating. The only way to cool a room when the heat is on is to open a window and then more street noises are heard. Internet service is 45 Euros per week, on top of your already too high room rate, and the signal is sketchey and weak at best. Don't expect to get the room you see in the advertisement it is not there. There is no carpet on the floor in the room which makes the room and rooms above even louder and colder in the winter. Do not even attempt to eat in the restaurant of the hotel. The food is cold and tasteless and very overpriced. After 3 days of a 5 day stay I returned to my room and neither of my room keys worked. I had an important call to be on and had to return to the front desk to have both keys activated and was told I had informed them I was checking out. Which I did not do then I was told I must have changed my reservation, which I did not do and finally they checked their computer system and found that the mistake was made by an overzealous clerk. No apologies were given and no renumeration for the mistake. Very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover.”
Reviews.Author: clownshoes
Reviews.Content: If you ever wondered what it was like in 1981, take a trip back in time and come stay at Hotel Convencion. Big ol' chandeliers in the lobby, dark, depressing carpets, a smokey, musty smell throughout, a souvenir store that sells porcelain figurines of cats and geese, it's got it all. The floral patterns on the bedspreads and curtains might excite your nan, if she can prise herself away from the gift shop tat. The hotel really needs a lick of paint, new bathrooms, and a modern outlook regarding providing broadband (ie, do it for free like everyone else). The room service menu offers cold meat, ham, cheese, ham and cheese sandwiches, hot beef sandwiches. Woo-woo! White bread and meat. I hope they also sell laxatives and Pepto-Bismol. The breakfast was the hotel's redeeming feature, serving a very good range of fruit (the peaches especially delicious), massive glazed and slightly bready croissants, the usual bacon, eggs, sausages, cereals and pastries. Service was attentive and swift, although there was no freshly squeezed orange juice, normally a given in Spain I would think. So many old musty hotels in Madrid at least offer historic architecture or a position on a lovely plaza or street. This place is on a busy road in a business district, in a 1970's/80's featureless brick building. On balance, no bueno.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cliona1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. the staff were really nice and the rooms were good. the hotel was good value for money and its very close to the metro. I found the bed comfortable and was happy with my stay

Reviews.Title: “Not a clue how it got a 4 star rating. Just go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: 1Angie
Reviews.Content: I'll be blunt. Don't stay here. I don't know how it would be 4 star, in Australia it would be 2. The location is fine, close to two subway stops and you and your heavy bags can travel to and from the airport on public transport without too much discomfort. Our roomed was meant to be non-smoking, but it reeked of smoke...the shower curtain, the toilet, the bedsheets etc. If you are a smoker, stay here so you'll be turned off your habit. Needless to say as allergy sufferers and asthmatics , this was unpleasant and we spent as little time in the room as possible. We had a lovely view of a skip, if you could see though the wet toilet paper that had been thrown at our window. The room was dark because we didn't want to open the curtains and allow around 50 other guests to see straight in. You get the idea. The reception is also very dark and unnatural. In such a sunny town like Madrid, it felt all wrong. To end on a positive, we were given complimentary late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Mattsay
Reviews.Content: The Convencion certainly isn't misnamed, it feels like a convention centre, with all the charm that implies. While it's not badly located in a fairly nice area about 20 minutes walk from the centre, the hotel itself lacks the feel of a place you'd like to be for any length of time. My room had no natural light at all. It wasn't small, but the only window faced a tiny internal courtyard ('hole' would be a better word). The bathroom was basic (I can't believe hotels still have those 1960s hairdryers!). While there is plenty to do in Madrid and you don't need to be in the hotel for long, it's also nice to think you've got somewhere pleasant to come back to. This hotel isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “2 days city break”
Reviews.Author: SensationP
Reviews.Content: As it was our main intention to visit the Red Bull X-Fighters Event on that day in Madrid we search for a hotel close to Plaza de Toros. The hotel is quite good located only appr. 500 meters close to a metro station and it took us 45 minutes from the airport by metro. To the city center and to Plaza de toros it took us 15 minutes. .. Location is quite good. The rooms are ok, more or less clean, but a little bit dark. Further the hotel could need a some renovation concerning the furniture, but ok. We booked for 1 night, 2 pax, breakfast included and paid 73€, so we did not expect much. As we arrived very early (09:00) I was quite happy that the room was already ready for us( normal check in time 12:00). As I than also asked for late check out on the next day we were guaranteed to stay until 2p.m without extra charge and afterwards could place our luggage in the storage. Very convenient as our plane left at 20:35. The breakfast buffet was ok and there was sufficient things available, even though the quality could have been better. A little bit annoying was that the internet was quite expensive(1€/10minutes), the printouts for our online-check in tickets were even worse and one of the stations could not open pdf files, so we had to do the check in twice, and of course, pay double. All in all, price/quality relations for a city hotel in the capital at that time of the year is quite ok, if you only need to stay 1 or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - In need of updating though”
Reviews.Author: Jonnym_7
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from spending 3 nights at this hotel. Upon arrival it is obvious that this is quite an old hotel and also very large, as I believe it has over 700 rooms. The check in process was very quick, with 3 rooms on the 3rd floor all next to one another and thankfully the rooms were not overlooking the main road so were very quiet. The rooms are very large and clean, but are in need of updating, but bathrooms are quite up to date but could do with a larger more modern shower head. Breakfast was also included, and there is an ok selection, lots of ham and cheese and also bread. Also there are a selection of cereals and hot drinks. The hotel is well located to the park, which is about a 10 minute walk, and there are also a few restaurants and supermarkets within a 5 minute walk. However, it is not well located for getting into the centre easily, as it takes about 45 minutes to walk to the lively santa anna plaza area and over 30 minutes to the lively Gran Via area. Taxi's back to the hotel from these areas at night were around the 7 euro mark. All in all though, for the price, the hotel is very good, but would probably say a 3 star hotel and not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and friendly”
Reviews.Author: LondonCes
Reviews.Content: About 20 minutes away from the airport, about 500 m from nearest Metro station and four blocks from the beautiful Retiro Park, this is a hotel for convenience. Although it could probably do with a re-vamp, the facilities were adequate and the rooms clean and functional. Despite being such a huge hotel, all the staff were patient and helpful and dealt with any queries efficiently. If you want a romantic hideway, luxury or fine dining, this probably isn't the place for you. On the other hand, if you're looking for a good value for money base for sightseeing (€7 taxi ride to historic area) or a business stay, Hotel Convencion offers all you need.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: fatig
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation through the net with an excellent promotion and after reading some comments, I confess I was afraid... but it surprised me positively! The employees were very friendly, the room large enough, and located in a residential area although it was very good, close to two metro lines, with shops and restaurants nearby and a 20 minutes walk from downtown, and we can choose alternative ways to go. The only thing negative was the view from the room window overlooking a courtyard without light... I liked it and would not mind anything back again to the Hotel Convencion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely trip to madrid”
Reviews.Author: Loaydodo
Reviews.Content: one of the most beautiful cities i'v ever been , Hotel was so good :-))

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: dizzyboop
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but I was only in the room to sleep. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. That was all I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4-star by any standards”
Reviews.Author: loopygal
Reviews.Content: I had no choice about this hotel, as it was booked for me for a conference, and after reading some of the reviews I was quite afraid to stay here. I wouldn´t exactly call it scary, it´s a decent place to sleep, but it´s definitely not 4-star or worth the price they charge; the rooms were quite run down and not very clean, and the door to the bathroom didn´t close. If I was paying for my own room I´d definitely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel I've stayed in for a long time. The travel agent at work booked it, and as soon as we walked in, I knew it was a mistake. It's fairly close to the centre of town, but that doesn't make up for the rest of it's shortcomings. Certainly not a 4 star hotel, I'd have trouble rating it even 2 star, to be honest. The lobby is like Picadilly circus - hundreds of people milling about. It's all part of the convention centre, so there are meeting rooms and coffee bars downstairs, and about 700 rooms upstairs. Even with 5 people manning reception, it still took 30 mins to check in, and staff were unhelpful. The room itself was down about 1/2 a mile of darkish corridors. I walked in to be confronted with a tiny room, comprising a teeny desk, oversized TV and a sofa made up as a single bed. However, my initial outrage was calmed by walking round the corner of the sofa to see another 2 rooms and bathroom, so overall, the size was great, especially if you have kids with you. Bedroom was huge, but looked out onto a main road, so was noisy. I needed those earplugs! Bed was not particularly comfortable, but was big and clean. Bathroom was fine, OK toiletries, good shower. Slightly bizarre set up with the loo and bidet beyond saloon-style doors within the main bathroom, didn't really see the point. Everything VERY dated, especially the soft furnishings. And some of the electricity sockets were frankly dangerous. Desk too small really for any useful work. And then we come to my main complaint. Despite advertising itself as a business hotel, this place is anything but. The wireless internet costs extra. And DO NOT PAY FOR IT IN ADVANCE as it doesn't work properly. The signal kept disconnecting and reconnecting, every few seconds or minutes. If you're looking at hotmail, you might not notice, as the page would just seem slow. But if you need to do any type of file transfer or access virtual desktops, it's utterly pointless as you keep getting logged out. I phoned reception 3 times. No help there. Completely uninterested. Kept putting me through to the wireless internet manager, who was never there. I went down to reception to complain in person. Still not interested. In the morning, they had the cheek to ask me to pay for it, even though there was a note that it hadn't worked. I refused to pay, which started a full-blown argument at the cashiers desk. They had the cheek to tell me that it was my fault I had no signal, because basically girls don't understand computers. As someone who sets up (functional) computer systems on a daily basis, I rather took exception to this comment. The result was eventually that the manager was called, and he agreed that I didn't need to pay. But by this point I was absolutely fuming. And my mood was not helped by the taxi situation. The desk staff will not call cabs, there's a porter outside who basically tries to flag them down. But the road the hotel is situated on is not a good one for catching cabs, they are all full by the time they go past. After standing fruitlessly in the rain for 10 mins, watching him gesture half-heartedly at a selection of occupied cabs, along with 50 other people wanting taxis, we walked about 5 mins down the road towards the hospital and caught a cab from there. Not ideal with loads of luggage, but otherwise we'd have been waiting all day. All in all, if I never return here, it'll be too soon.

Reviews.Title: “Conventional Convencion -Very adequate”
Reviews.Author: Jacko48
Reviews.Content: My wife & I live in Spain on the Costa Blanca and went on a four day break to Madrid on a coach tour. The tour company changed the hotel at the last minute from the Florida Norte because clients on the last tour experienced food poisoning there, and we were glad because Trip Advisor subscribers also condemned it. At the Convencion we experienced a very smooth check-in and the rooms on the 4th Floor were large, clean and comfortable. Some rooms may be noisier than others but that's the luck of the draw in big city hotels and ours was fine. The hotel has two separate dining rooms and as we were on a budget tour we had the canteen version for a continental breakfast - adequate but basic and plentiful - you get what you pay for so can't complain. Buffet breakfasts in big hotels can always be a bit of a battlefield - it's part of the fun -- but I expect a number of folk would disagree? We ate one evening meal in the main hotel restaurant, and that was very good with excellent service - but expensive. In a typical commercial hotel with 700+ rooms you have to expect some disruption and a busy reception area, but despite one night when Real Madrid were beaten by Roma to the delight of a group of exuberant Italian students even they were well behaved. There were no complaints from our coach party. We would recommend this hotel as a reasonable place to stay for a brief trip to this lovely city. Also, the hotel is surely just to sleep overnight between the sightseeing musts that Madrid has to offer, and it is in a good location for that. My worst experience was trying to watch CNN for basic news bulletins. It is awful in comparison with all three British news channels of Sky, BBC and ITV, and the reception was poor. If you want 5 Star accommodation seriously try India or the Far East!

Reviews.Title: “More Like Ma-DREAD ACC-idental”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler12
Reviews.Content: Wow...I was hoping for a nice stay in Madrid with my wife. Boy, did we book the wrong place. I walked into the hotel room and got the faintest smell of potato chips. However, the smell got worse and worse and turned out to not be potato chips, after all...The last guest had left a bloody sock under the bed, which was never picked up until my wife's teary testimonial to the hotal clerk was enough to get them out of their chairs. This wasn't the last hardship we would endur. The next morning we awoke to the sound of a middle-aged spaniard in a thong pounding at our door. We couldn't come from out of the bathroom until 20 minutes later when he was finally coralled by the police. In fact, the police were probably the only positive aspect of the trip, itself. We moved down the street to a 5-star hotel and slept soundly and enjoyed our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not great....”
Reviews.Author: Ixxy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic, and not the best 3-star hotel we've been to. The room we stayed in was dark and dingy. The breakfast room felt more like a canteen. Saying that, we didn't pay a lot of money for it(about £200 each for flight and accommodation as part of a last minute deal), and it was a decent roof over our heads. If you're on a budget and can get a good deal on it, go for it. It's decent enough. If not, you may wish to look elasewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old matress, old funiture,bad service.”
Reviews.Author: jovi809
Reviews.Content: Is a very large hotel for Madrid , . I did not like nothing in this hotel Its to croud and bad service. Rooms are a bit large, but furniture are old and the bed are HORRIBLE!!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: Tashko
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the first floor, which even by the wildest stretch of a magnanimous imagination cannot be described as a 4-star accomodation - even a 3 star rating would seem rather charitable. It felt cheap and bland in every respect. Towards the end of our stay it became clear that the hotel management considers only the hotel's upper floors to be of 4-star caliber, with the two lower floors falling under some unclear status, pending renovation work ( a fact which, to be fair to them, was also reflected upon the reduced price. ) The hotel just feels so very basic, geared mostly towards large group accomodation and tourists on short stays with much to do outside the hotel itself - there aren't many facilities or restaurant/bar options to make someone excited with the prospect of staying much indoors. That did not bother us since we fitted perfectly into the second category ; but what was clearly unacceptable was the noise penetrating into our room at night, coming from all kinds of obvious and other more mysterious sources. The lobby was also quite noisy ( or lively according to one's point of view ) given the large tourist groups that were hunging there mostly in the evening. The location is very good for those wishing close proximity to Salamanca and easy access to the city centre. The staff was pleasant and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Big & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: RexhameBill
Reviews.Content: Large hotel, very busy with business and tour travelers which included many school or tourist groups. Rooms are a bit larger, not well appointed and reasonably maintained. Tour groups, many of school age, had the run of the place. Security in the evening not adequate. Be prepared to listen to the "spring break racket" between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “located near a great bus line”
Reviews.Author: anitamich
Reviews.Content: This hotel was prebooked by a travel company who included 2 nts here and a nt in Barcelona prior to a 15 nt transatlantic cruise returning to Miami. This is a huge hotel so you can't expect much or any service from the front desk. They try their best but appeared to be short staffed all the time. The room was a decent size. I liked the bathroom. There were two sinks in it and my roommate and I both had our own then. The hairdryer was helpful. The beds were comfortable. Everything was very clean. There was a huge breakfast buffet included in a large banquet room that was usually filled up with lots of tourists. I was satisfied with it and the selection. While it certainly wasn't gourmet, there was certainly enough to chose from. On the other hand, my roommate was dissatisfied and felt it was rather pedestrian. So there are two varying opinions. The best thing about the hotel was that right outside the door was a bus that took you down to the Grand Via where there were stores and restaurants, people watching, internet cafes etc. Lunch seems to be the best deal in Barcelona with a complete meal being served for ten dollars or less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: stephantravel
Reviews.Content: While totally anonymous and somewhat lacking character, the hotel offers great prices for decently sized, comfortable and exceptionally quiet rooms (not that usual for a hotel in the centre in Madrid!) The staff may be a bit moody but was generally pleasant. Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleaseant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Good service. Large rooms and bathrooms. Good A/C. Very good breakfast and gourmet restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but sadly some problems!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Willowslea
Reviews.Content: What a shame! The hotel is well situated, five minutes from the Retiro Park and five minutes from Goya Metro station. - The rooms are good, everywhere is clean and well decorated BUT the whole hotel is SO dark. There is little natural light and poor lighting. Our room looked out to rooms opposite and rooms were built like looking down a "well", really no light came into the room. Only one pillow per person, do ask for an extra! We were admittedly on a budget package holiday, but I have never had such a dreadful experience at breakfast - we went first to the restaurant, but were abruptly directed to a huge room, where we were eating off trays, it was little better than a canteen - the so called juice was awful, as was the coffee out of a machine. There was no variation, NOT NICE - we did this twice and afterwards found other places for a good breakfast. Madrid though is fabulous - this was our first visit - whatever you do don't miss The Opera Restaurant, where opera singers, from the Opera House entertain you as you eat and the Sorolla Museum, home and gallery of the Spanish artist. Have fun in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: Checked in. Checked out. Went to the Ritz even though we had pre paid this hotel. Dump. Madrid is a wonderful city, with the friendliest of people. Enjoy this city, but avoid this hotel, it really is that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff that really makes you feel at home. I love it here every time I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid on September I was violently robbed just a few steps from the hotel, the streets in Madrid are poorly lighted and the hotel is very dark and difficult to access, no bellboy at certain hours, the hotel is crowded with tourists but thiefs know this, so dont carry videocamaras, avoid walking and always check your back specially around museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the above review - complaining about a glass of ice!!!! Jesus, doe the guy have no life - you are in one of Europe's greatest cities - go out and appreciate the culture and the nightlife! The hotel provides a good place to stay - great location and good facilities - nothing amazing, but in Madrid - if you are drinking or eating in the hotel, well, you are there for the wrong reasons!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: son_travel2004
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The rooms are very nice, the staff is great, taking into consideration that people in Madrid are not very friendly, nor service oriented. Breakfast is also excellent and the hotel is centrally located a few blocks from El Retiro Park (a Madrid must go).
